comment: Go 선생님 is really nice. She is willing to help you out if needed but you really have to make sure to pay attention to the basics if not the rest will be difficult to grasp.

Very easy to communicate with in/after class and very understanding with brand new speakers. If you listen in class and actually use the AMPLE resources she gives you're gonna learn Korean super easily. She clearly wants you to learn. You do get points off for not coming to class without notice. You don't really need the required textbook, lol.

definitely recommend her if you're starting out in Korean! her lectures are easy to understand and she helps when you need it. she makes class engaging. I've taken her online and in-person classes, she's very passionate in making you understand the language.

I cannot extoll her amazingness enough! I'm an almost forty year old and she made me absolutely fall in love with the Korean language and she gave me more confidence to believe in myself. I only wish I could take more classes but all my electives are done now. TAKE HER! Best in the department!

She does expect you to review the material before you come to class, so if you don't, you will likely be behind. She is very sweet and very helpful when you don't understand concepts. There's a lot of homework but there's several attempts, and there are two quizzes per unit with two attempts. If you put in some effort, you can get an A easily.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: This class was very fast paced at times, but it was very fun. She was always very helpful and responsive to questions. Vocab quizzes, lockdown tests, 2 skits (one in a group), workbook homework, and voice recording assignments. Take this class only if you have the self discipline and organization for it. Befriend and study with classmates!

Easily the best class I took this semester and the Prossefor is so fun to have as your teacher. Yes, she does give a lot of busy work but it is very easy. You can miss class 2 times but after that, it comes out of your grade. She is always there to help you even at like 11 P.M. There will be enough work to get an easy A in the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: She is a wonderful teacher, you need help and she's there. Very patient, she does give busy work but it is only to help you be better in the class.
Amazing person, amazing professor!

Professor Ko is amazing. She truly cares about her students and you can tell she has a passion for teaching Korean. I took her summer course, which is packed with several hours of homework and studying each week, but she was very understanding with late assignments and was available anytime I wanted to meet with her for help. 10/10 professor.

Professor Ko wasn't a horrible choice but there could be better. You're given pages in the workbook to do but you're also given the key so it isn't difficult at all. Quizzes/Exams can be pretty tough but homework and recordings help balance the grade. Don't stress about the recording because she doesn't grade rough at all and they are pretty easy!

Professor Ko was an absolute delight! I loved taking her class. I was nervous about taking my first Korean class, but she made it so fun and welcoming. She is very helpful and really wants to see all of her students do well, so she does everything she can to help. Very interactive classroom and she gives you many online learning resources.

Professor Ko is an AMAZING teacher. She truly cares about the success of her students and makes herself available to help! I have health issues that keep me from going to class sometimes and she was always willing to help me. It does require several hours of studying / work a week but its to help you really understand what youre learning.

Professor Ko is SUCH a great Korean professor! She really cares for her students, and really wants you to do well in the class. So long as you just show up and do your work, and turn it in ON time- there's really absolutely no way you can fail this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Ko Is very kind but also very quick on covering things in class. always good to study the vocab you're doing the night before. It's a lot of self teaching but if your struggling her office hours are always helpful. everything you learn in class is also in the workbook/textbook. All and all good teacher and interesting class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I love Korean culture but I am kinda regret to take this class. Professor are kinda expecting us to self-taught, and she will just quickly go through it in class and you will have a quiz. You have to work really hard to get a good grade in this class because there is so much work to do. Attendance is mandatory.

The professor is nice, but she is coving too much materials in one class. After class, you will have so many pages of homework, recording assignment, group skit presentation, book project, etc. Every class will have either vocabulary quiz or test, even though she just go through the first time of those vocabulary. Definitely won't take it again.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you love Korean, then this class will be a breeze. She is a very caring teacher, and provides many resources. A lot of work outside of class, but I enjoyed every second. The assignments were fun, and the tests were easy. Couldn't have asked for a better introduction.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is genuinely passionate about her language and the success of her students, which makes for a good classroom environment. Expect book work and practice outside of the classroom, but other than that it's a fairly easy class. Her enthusiasm is infectious!

Professor Ko is by far my favorite professor yet. She is incredibly caring and wants every one of her students to do well. The material is a challenging but if you put in the effort you will do well. She takes the time to help students individually if needed. You have a ton of work to do through out the semester but that is the best way to learn.

Professor Ko is a great intro teacher! She's very helpful and gives you plenty of time to study the course content. She has quizzes 2x before each test but she goes over everything in a PPT the day of, so if you study you'll definitely get an A. She offers tons of extra credit and ways to get involved in the Korean community!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's nice and cares about her students. She always says when she's available outside of class, and she lets you correct tests and quizzes for half points back. She does throw a ton of vocab and grammar at you, and the class goes way too quickly to be comfortable (I was lost in class most of the time.) Still, an easy class if you do the work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a nice lady but the material we sped through. I was one to get to class right on time and she would have already done a pre-class activity. About halfway through the class you have a headache because so much is coming at you. The one thing I absolutely hated was the vocabulary quizzes right after you went over the vocabulary for the 1st time

Professor Ko is probably one of the best Korean professors we have at KSU. Attendance is mandatory and it WILL be hard to catch up since it is a foreign language course. She assigns workbook pages I believe every week and she does post the answer keys online to help you. GO to her office hours when you don't understand a concept.
